tidyGWAS 0.2.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Create a dataframe with tidyGWAS column names

    tidyGWAS_columns.Rd

    tidyGWAS functions assumes fixed column names. This function facilitates renaming column into tidyGWAS format

    Usage

    tidyGWAS_columns(
  tbl,
  CHR = "CHR",
  POS = "POS",
  RSID = "RSID",
  EffectAllele = "EffectAllele",
  OtherAllele = "OtherAllele",
  B = "B",
  SE = "SE",
  P = "P",
  EAF = "EAF",
  N = "N",
  CaseN = "CaseN",
  ControlN = "ControlN",
  INFO = "INFO",
  Z = "Z",
  OR = "OR"
)

    Arguments

    tbl

    a data.frame

    CHR

    chromosome

    POS

    position

    RSID

    rsID from dbSNP

    EffectAllele

    allele corresponding to effect, B

    OtherAllele

    non-effect allele

    B

    Beta, effect,

    SE

    standard error

    P

    p value

    EAF

    effect-allele frequency

    N

    total sample size (case + control)

    CaseN

    number of cases (for case-control phenotypes)

    ControlN

    number of controls (for case-control phenotypes)

    INFO

    INFO score, imputation accuracy

    Z

    Z score

    OR

    odds-ratio

    Value

    a tibble with changes column names

    Examples

    wrong_format <- dplyr::tibble(CHROM = 1, bp = 1000, A1 = "C", A2 = "A", Effect = 0.05)
formatted <- tidyGWAS_columns(
wrong_format, CHR = "CHROM", POS = "bp",
EffectAllele = "A1", OtherAllele = "A2", B = "Effect"
)
